alert.note: Alert for Guernsey; Monroe; Muskingum; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 10:10PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL GUERNSEY...NORTHWESTERN MONROE...EASTERN MUSKINGUM AND NORTHERN NOBLE COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 PM EDT... At 1009 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Zanesville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Zanesville, Cambridge, New Concord, Byesville, North Zanesville, Philo, Pleasant Grove, Senecaville, Pleasant City, Cumberland, Lore City, and Old Washington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 155 and 194. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 30 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
